business_overview.offer_summary: Dealer for Graceland Sheds operating three lots in Northern Arizona (Tuba City, Flagstaff, Williams). Sells storage sheds, garages, cabins with rent-to-own financing options. Also has GC license via Remus Development for contractor services.
business_overview.ideal_customer: Northern Arizona residents and businesses needing storage solutions. Mix of in-person lot visitors and remote buyers reached via web/social.
business_overview.customer_journey_brief: Customers discover via lot visits, Facebook Marketplace, website, or Google search. On-lot visitors browse ~20 buildings, often leaving without contact captured. Initial contact through lot attendant, phone calls, or online lead forms. Sales process involves pricing discussions, RTO terms explanation, customization options. Order placed through Graceland system, built at plant (6-8 weeks winter, 3-5 weeks spring/summer), inspected by driver Scott, delivered to customer. Post-sale includes warranty support and potential upsell (contractor services, expansions).
business_overview.long_term_vision: Platformizable dealership ops solution across portable buildings, greenhouses, shipping containers, metal buildings, and contractor services. Potential rollout to Graceland dealer network.

key_stakeholders.primary_champion: Chris Andrade (Son - Agency Lead, Owner/Operator via Remus Development, GC license holder)
key_stakeholders.owner: Sandra 'Sandy' Bomyea (Mom - Owner, sales lead, final decision maker)
key_stakeholders.delivery_partner: Scott Passmore (Graceland - Hub creation, logistics support)
key_stakeholders.kayenta_manager: Eli Gray Eyes (Proposed - Architect, 3 days/week at Kayenta)
key_stakeholders.kayenta_staff: Gray Eyes' Brother (Proposed - Remaining days + Tuba support)

pain_points: Difficulty understanding daily operating margins to hire confidently
Financial clarity gaps making staffing decisions hard
functions.notes: Finance runs through Graceland for order processing. Need better visibility into lot-level profitability.

pain_points: ON-LOT LEAD LEAKAGE: Single attendant cannot capture multiple simultaneous visitors
Prospects browse and leave without contact captured
No way to follow up with interested parties who didn't buy
Time drain answering repetitive questions (pricing, RTO, timelines)
Both foot traffic AND phone/web leads affected
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: On-lot lead leakage is now identified as the #1 pain point, higher priority than paused ads. This drives the QR/slot MVP approach.

key_responsibilities: Chambers of Commerce and BBB listings
pain_points: Paused paid ads (~$400/mo) led to traffic collapse
Previous SEO vendors ($800-$1,200/mo) had unclear ROI - skepticism remains
Website has broken image rendering and mobile UX problems
SEO visibility dropped for 'sheds near me' searches
Limited analytics understanding - uncertain attribution
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: Focus shifted from traffic generation to capture optimization. White-label marketing option via Krista Green discussed ($1k/mo wholesale, $1.2-2.8k resale).

pain_points: Repetitive questions drain time (pricing, RTO, timelines)
Information already in listings but customers don't find it
No 24/7 coverage for inquiries
Customer frustration from delivery/dispatch issues
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: Chatbot deprioritized vs QR capture. FAQ automation is Phase 2.

pain_points: DELIVERY FRICTION: Drivers lack site specifics before delivery
Failed/infeasible deliveries due to site constraints (access roads, clearances)
NetSuite (Graceland) passes minimal info to dealers
Dispatch texting/call follow-up failures caused cancellations
Custom orders occasionally built wrong (12-15% error rate)
Build errors cause 2+ week delays, odd inventory
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: Delivery handoff artifact (customer-to-driver link with maps/instructions) identified as potential solution. Scott now independent, calls/schedules directly.

pain_points: LEAD LEAKAGE: Cannot capture multiple simultaneous visitors
No system to track who looked at what
No follow-up mechanism for browsers who leave
No measurement of traffic vs conversion
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: NEW FUNCTION identified. This is the primary focus of the MVP - QR/slot system to enable self-service capture and attendant notification.

pain_points: Excel-driven processes prone to breakage
Potential external refs/macros in spreadsheets
No integration between inventory and lead tracking
Graceland portal is read-only
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: NEW FUNCTION identified. Inventory management ties into QR/slot system - each slot maps to current building in that position.

pain_points: Difficulty finding quality help
Lack of clarity on margins makes hiring decisions hard
300-page SOT document is overwhelming
Need better dashboards for visibility
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: Chris Andrade identified as primary champion. SOT v1 document requires AI processing for MVP extraction.

pain_points: Broken image rendering on website
Mobile UX problems
Disconnected systems (website, ads, Facebook, Zoho not unified)
Excel may have external refs/macros blocking migration
No AI/chatbot optimization on website
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: Website access ready 'whenever'. Need to check Excel dependencies before migrating to Sheets.

key_responsibilities: GC license holder for contractor work
Potential services: pads, septic, access roads
pain_points: No structured path to offer ancillary services
Losing high-value contractor revenue
Customer trust gap - don't know services are available
functions.notes: POST-DISCOVERY UPDATE: NEW FUNCTION identified. Chris has GC license that could enable significant upsell revenue. Not MVP scope but future opportunity.

overload_and_gaps.owner_overload_summary: Sandra wears multiple hats (sales, customer service, admin). Chris Andrade emerging as strategic driver with platform vision. On-lot attendants are overwhelmed by multi-visitor scenarios. Family business with distributed lot management creates coordination challenges.
missing_or_weak_functions: On-lot lead capture system (NO mechanism to capture multiple simultaneous visitors)
Inventory-to-lead tracking (no link between who looked at what)
Delivery site verification (no pre-delivery site assessment)
top_3_risks: On-lot lead leakage - visitors browse and leave without capture, no follow-up possible
Delivery friction - drivers lack site specifics, failed deliveries waste time/cost
Scope creep - 300-page SOT + platform vision could expand engagement indefinitely
top_3_opportunities: QR/Slot capture system - turn passive lot browsing into tracked leads with instant attendant notification
Platform play - success at S&S could roll out to entire Graceland dealer network
Contractor services upsell - leverage GC license for pads, septic, access roads

mvp_scope: QR/Slot system: 20 fixed slot QR codes per lot with backend inventory mapping
Website intake form with guided flow and instant attendant notifications
Lead-to-building tracking: link scans to specific inventory
Basic scan analytics: who looked at what, multi-scan tracking
quick_wins_30_days: Deploy QR slot codes at one lot (proof of concept)
Add intake form with email/SMS notification to attendant
Set up lead-to-inventory tracking spreadsheet or simple CRM
90_day_priorities: Roll out QR system to all 3 lots
Implement lightweight CRM with customer portfolio tracking
Add delivery handoff artifact (site specs link for drivers)
Traffic counting via camera at single entry/exit
deprioritized_from_original: AI Chatbot for FAQ automation (now Phase 2+)
Resume paid ads (capture first, then traffic)
suggested_future_roles_or_partners: White-label marketing via Krista Green ($1k/mo wholesale)
Platform development team for Graceland network rollout
Analytics partner for traffic counting implementation

discovery_timeline.status: Scope expanded - accountability system + multi-location ops
discovery_timeline.next_sync: TBD - clarify QR vs accountability priority

new_dealership_hub.lots_available: Two lots over 1 acre each, already cleaned out and ready

office_setup.source: Use existing building from backyard inventory

accountability_system.type: Proprietary app with individual dealer logins
accountability_system.chris_quote: This is what I think is how we at least eliminate the issue with dealerships and finding quality help
daily_checklist: Did you get gas today? Do you need gas tomorrow?
Did you turn the lights on?
Did you make sure all keys are put away?
Did you spend an hour cleaning up the lot?
One social media post per day of favorite building

deposit_process.cash_handling: Sandra knows exact amount from system, rep deposits at Wells Fargo
deposit_process.locations: Wells Fargo branches in Kayenta and Tuba
deposit_process.clock_out_rule: Send picture of deposit before clocking out

purpose: Ensure consistent customer experience across locations
Create performance metrics for monthly reviews
Enable bonus incentives tied to compliance + sales
Reduce Sandra's driving burden for oversight
accountability_system.sandra_current_method: Vehicle - driving to each location regularly
accountability_system.sandra_quote: Yes, I do. It's called a vehicle. I'm driving my ass off.

expected_roi.chris_vision: Eventually that 10,000 is going to be made back in a week, two weeks

long_term_vision.goal: Replicable dealership models with SOPs enabling delegation
